tactics.name: Category Selection with Publisher Rocket
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to analyze Amazon categories for optimal visibility and ranking by narrowing down to specific categories that align with the book's content.
steps: Open Publisher Rocket and navigate to the categories section
Identify specific Amazon categories and subcategories relevant to the book
Ensure categories match the book's content (covers, blurbs, etc.)
caveats: Amazon may reclassify books, so initial category choices are critical
source_quotes: Publisher Rocket gives you a data-driven approach to visibility and ranking.

tactics.name: category analysis
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to evaluate categories for growth trends, sales data, and competition insights
steps: Input keywords to generate category suggestions
Monitor category BSR and review metrics
caveats: When market shifts occur, categories may need frequent re-evaluation
source_quotes: you can use it for a lot of different things

tactics.name: category experimentation
tactics.description: Test different categories to optimize visibility and sales performance
caveats: Avoid duplicate categories for algorithm efficiency
source_quotes: change one at a time see if it affects your field

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews in a category are below 200, prioritize boosting visibility
source_quotes: 68% of the books in the category are listed in KU make life easy on yourself and list your book in KU.

heuristics.name: review benchmarking
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize categories with higher review counts
source_quotes: check at least every three-ish months

claims.statement: KDP requires authors to select three Amazon categories per book format (hardback, paperback, audiobook).
source_quotes: Every time you publish on KDP, you're going to need to pick three categories.

claims.statement: Self-published authors control category selection unlike traditional publishers
source_quotes: you don't pay any of this stuff. You have no control...

niche_patterns.description: Target specific niches by combining audience identity, their problems, and constraints (e.g., religious preferences).
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Narrowing categories aligns with reader search intent and avoids duplicate category selection.
source_quotes: You want to make sure that your Kindle book is only in Kindle category...
